perturbation.original_text: Unless otherwise defined, capitalised terms, singular or plural, used in this Amendment, shall have the same meaning ascribed thereto in the GMA.
perturbation.changed_text: Unless otherwise defined herein, capitalized terms, singular or plural, used in this Amendment, shall have the same meaning ascribed thereto in the GMA. However, for the purposes of Clause 2.1, capitalized terms shall have the meanings set forth specifically in that Clause, irrespective of definitions in the GMA.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by stating that terms generally follow the GMA's definitions, but then creating an exception in Clause 2.1 where the GMA definitions are explicitly overridden. This creates uncertainty as to which definition applies outside of Clause 2.1 if related terms are used elsewhere.

The initial statement says confidential information should not be released to any third party, including subsidiary companies, unless otherwise agreed in writing. The added sentence, however, states that disclosure *is* allowed to subsidiaries directly involved in maintenance services without prior written consent. This creates a direct contradiction regarding the rules for disclosing to subsidiary companies, making it unclear which rule prevails.

perturbation.original_text: 5.2.1 Subject to sub-Clause 5.2.5 below and in the event the Representatives (i) fail to create such committee or (ii) do not agree on an amicable settlement within [*****] from the date the committee referred to in this sub-Clause 5.2 has been created or such longer period as may be agreed upon in writing by the Representatives (the "Amicable Settlement Period"), the Dispute shall be exclusively and finally settled under the Rules and Conciliation of Arbitration of the International Chamber of Commerce (the "ICC") by an arbitral tribunal composed of three (3) arbitrators; each Party shall then appoint one (1) arbitrator within [*****]from the last day of the Amicable Settlement Period and the third arbitrator, who will act as President, will be appointed by the other two (2) arbitrators. In case the two (2) arbitrators appointed by the Parties do not agree on this choice with [*****] from the date the last arbitrator is appointed, the third arbitrator will be appointed by the ICC Court.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.2.1 Subject to sub-Clause 5.2.5 below and in the event the Representatives (i) fail to create such committee or (ii) do not agree on an amicable settlement within [*****] from the date the committee referred to in this sub-Clause 5.2 has been created or such longer period as may be agreed upon in writing by the Representatives (the "Amicable Settlement Period"), the Dispute may be settled under the Rules and Conciliation of Arbitration of the International Chamber of Commerce (the "ICC") by an arbitral tribunal composed of three (3) arbitrators; each Party shall then appoint one (1) arbitrator within [*****]from the last day of the Amicable Settlement Period and the third arbitrator, who will act as President, will be appointed by the other two (2) arbitrators. In case the two (2) arbitrators appointed by the Parties do not agree on this choice with [*****] from the date the last arbitrator is appointed, the third arbitrator will be appointed by the ICC Court.
perturbation.explanation: The original text states that if amicable settlement fails, the dispute "shall be exclusively and finally settled" by ICC arbitration. The modified text changes "shall be" to "may be," making arbitration optional. This creates a contradiction because it's no longer definitively clear if arbitration is the required method of dispute resolution.
